title: At level 6 Leblanc can root a target for 3 seconds--as an assassin
body:
How about we nerf this instead of continually destroying an assassin's ability to assassinate? The current PBE nerf to Leblanc's Q scaling will do nothing to her proplay presence because no one picks her specifically for damage--she has, bar none, the best gank assistance of any champion in the game. As long as she can dash two screens away and snare a target long enough for her team to collapse,she will continue to be a monster in coordinated play. But every nerf to her damage and CDs makes her worse and worse to play as a solo champion.

An assassin **should never** be able to hard cc anyone for as long as 3 seconds, but instead of nerfing that we nerf the assassin's numbers, making her less able to act independently because she can't make her own plays without her damage. At this point, I don't even care if you remove her snare entirely, just please stop nerfing an assassin's damage to preserve her cc that she shouldn't have in the first place.

Can they please nerf her E range after she hit you? Like you won't get away from being rooted, you simply won't. With her 1 1/2 dashes and her ability to outrun most champs and on top of that, if you and her run the same way, your flash won't even help you getting out of range.
Imo lacks a lot of counterplay.

I'd be totally fine with that. My biggest concern is nerfing an assassin's damage to the point where they can't assassinate anymore. Because, let's face it, this nerf won't do anything to affect Leblanc's proplay presence. What happens if she remains too strong and needs another nerf? Are we going to keep nerfing her damage until she just becomes the team's mobile cc bot?

Agreed, her damage isn't the problem, it's her utility.

She doesn't need 850 range on a tether that she hits at point blank then ports out with. It's impossible to break. Nerf that first.
Don't forget about the chain length, which is basically the entirety of Mid Lane, and it's hitbox is the size of a Cho'Gath at the end.
If she is using her r to also snare you, isn’t she like slicing her damage in half?
Her R snare is the same damage as her R Q, and she doesn't need the damage for gank assistance like the OP said

Yeah, it's the same damage, but over 3 seconds, and 2 different procs of damage, so even if it wasn't a gank, the time to kill has been significantly lengthened if they go this route. 

Meanwhile, they Q-Q-W for the same damage, but much more reliably. The only thing rooting does for you is maybe get you some more auto-attacks in midstwhile. If they're aiming to reduce her abiility to kill faster, then Q is the thing they should nerf.

 I imagine Riot already considers the Root strategy a fairer option, considering that they've pushed Time to Kill as a bigger thing for them since the Assassin Class rework. More seconds alive, means more time to respond.

Except you can't really respond, especially if it's used to assist ganks. You have to flash and use a dash to get out, her blinks and passive make her safe, and the enemy jungler getting that extra time to pound your ass is more than worth the longer TTK.

Respond doesn't always mean run away. She's setting you up to stick by her for a minimum of 3 seconds, attack back, you're not just a lamb to the slaughter. Most midlaners have some form of CC, plenty do. 

That said, you can respond, at the very beginning. You can dodge the first snare, and before anyone says you can't dodge it when she goes point blank, yes, you can. Sidestep. All Leblancs are going to think you're going to run away, so just repress the lizard part of your brain for a second, and side step. Once you see her Dashing towards you, that's when.

 Even if she follows up with Ult R, that's still just a normal root/slow, just damage is better.

This actually isn't true. Leblanc's most optimal early-mid game kill combo almost always involves double chain. A lot of people may not know this, but Leblanc's double chain combo does the same exact amount of damage as her double Q combo **at all stages of the game**. Double chain is better early-mid because it gives you 3 full seconds of autoattacks (boosted by corrupting pot) and even a second Q or W depending on how long the fight lasts. Double Q is only used late game because its faster.

The root duration wouldn't be that big of a problem if the chain wasn't so long.

Mages, especially mobile mages, are in an amazing(dare I say OP) place in general. You take a look at most elo's and top/mid(duh) and even support win/pick rates, and mages are well represented compared to ad/tanky variants in most cases. Mage items are dirt cheap, give great stats, and ultimately lead to most of them being able to 100 to 0 in a combo or less. Mage power creep is a problem all over the map, and I'd love to see it addressed in general.

She's picked in pro because of her high mobility and high damage for assassinations.  Her root is good, but using RE is super situational which is why you don't really see them go for it that often.  She isn't  picked specifically for the reason that she can potentially root someone for 3 seconds.

I think Riot wants to shift {{champion:7}} to an identity as a hybrid catcher + assassin (or burst-mage).  Her assassin/burst-mage identity is already strongly established, but her potential as a catcher is less established, so weakening her damage output and retaining her mobility+CC helps gradually define her secondary catcher class.  I think it's a good thing and makes LB more appealing to me personally.  If she could get slightly higher base defenses as compensation for the damage nerfs, I'd probably pick her up as a catcher support, and she'd still be plenty playable for mid laners as an assassin.

We already got plenty of assassins that jump in, burst down the carry and leave.
An assassin that can jump in, disable the enemy tank/bruiser is a lot more interesting than the generic assassin
